Module ntnu.idatt1002
Package ntnu.idatt1002.dao

Class TaskDAO

java.lang.Object
ntnu.idatt1002.dao.TaskDAO
public final class TaskDAO
extends java.lang.Object
The class TaskDAO provides static methods for handling Task objects. In the storage system the files get saved in a hierarchy of folder based on the objects variables. Normal tasks get saved under 'Categories/category/' while project tasks get saved under 'Projects/project/category/'.

  • Constructor Details

    • TaskDAO

      public TaskDAO()

  • Method Details

    • list

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Task> list​(java.lang.String username)
      Get all Task objects stored under a given User. This includes both regular tasks and project tasks.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList, or null if the user doesn't exist.

    • list

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Task> list​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String category)
      Get all Task objects within a category under a User.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      category - the name of the category.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList, or null if either the user or the category doesn't exist.

    • list

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Task> list​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String project, java.lang.String category)
      Get all Task objects within a project category for a User.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      project - the name of the project.
      category - the name of the category.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList, or null if either the user, the project, or the category doesn't exist.

    • serialize

      public static void serialize​(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks)
      Serialize the given ArrayList of Task objects. The list can contain objects belonging to different users, projects and categories. They will be stored in their respective folders.
      Parameters:
      tasks - an ArrayList of Task objects.

    • serialize

      public static void serialize​(Task task)
      Serialize the given Task object to storage. The location is based on the tasks username, project and category variables.
      Parameters:
      task - a Task object.

    • deserialize

      public static Task deserialize​(java.lang.String username, long id)
      Returns a Task object from storage matching the given arguments. Since neither category or project is provided, this method will search through the entire User folder. To increase effectiveness, provide more arguments.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      id - the id variable for the Task.
      Returns:
      a Task object, or null if the file could not be found. Either the user doesn't exist or a task with the given id exists.

    • deserialize

      public static Task deserialize​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String category, long id)
      Returns a Task object from storage matching the given arguments. This method only retrieves from the 'Categories' folder. For project tasks the project name needs to be passed as an argument as well, or remove the category and search the entire user folder.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      category - the name of the category.
      id - the id variable for the Task.
      Returns:
      a Task object, or null if the file could not be found. Either the user, the category, or a task with the given id doesn't exist.

    • deserialize

      public static Task deserialize​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String project, java.lang.String category, long id)
      Returns a Task object from storage matching the given arguments.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      project - the name of the project.
      category - the name of the category.
      id - the id variable for the Task.
      Returns:
      a Task object, or null if the file could not be found. Either the user, the project, the category, or a task with the given id doesn't exist.

    • deleteByUser

      public static boolean deleteByUser​(java.lang.String username)
      Delete all Task files under a given User folder. This includes both regular and project tasks.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if some or all elements failed to delete, normally if the user doesn't exist.

    • deleteByCategory

      public static boolean deleteByCategory​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String category)
      Delete all Task files under a given category for a User. To delete all tasks within a project category the project needs to be passed as an argument as well.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      category - the name of the category.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if some or all elements failed to delete, either the user or the category doesn't exist.

    • deleteByProjectCategory

      public static boolean deleteByProjectCategory​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String project, java.lang.String category)
      Delete all Task files under a given project category for a User.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      project - the name of the project.
      category - the name of the category.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if some or all elements failed to delete, either the user, the project, or the category doesn't exist.

    • delete

      public static boolean delete​(Task task)
      Delete a Task file from storage.
      Parameters:
      task - the object to be deleted.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if the file isn't stored.

    • delete

      public static boolean delete​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String category, long id)
      Delete a Task file matching the given arguments.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      category - the name of the category.
      id - the id variable for the Task.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if the file couldn't be deleted, either the user, the category, or a task with the given id doesn't exist.

    • delete

      public static boolean delete​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String project, java.lang.String category, long id)
      Delete a Task file matching the given arguments.
      Parameters:
      username - the username variable in a User.
      project - the name of the project.
      category - the name of the category.
      id - the id variable for the Task.
      Returns:
      True if succesfull. False if the file couldn't be deleted, either the user, the project, the category, or a task with the given id doesn't exist.
